problem_text:
Suppose that G is a periodic group with an involution i such that ig · i has odd order for any g ∈G. Is it true that the image of i in G/O(G) belongs to the centre of G/O(G)?
A. V. Borovik
answer: No, not always (E. B. Durakov, A. I. Sozutov, Algebra Logic, 52, no. 5 (2013), 422–425).
